name: Worcester Commons
description: Located in the Northeast Residential Area, Worcester Dining Commons is the newest and one of the most popular dining facilities on campus. Worcester offers a variety of options including Mediterranean, authentic street food, tandoor Indian kitchen, hand rolled sushi, noodle bowls, pizza, and much more!

name: Franklin Dining Commons
description: Located in the Central Residential Area, Franklin Dining Commons is famous for its vegan and vegetarian cuisine. With a fully kosher kitchen, vegetarian line, hand rolled sushi, pasta bar, stir fry station, pizza, authentic international cuisine, there is an option for everyone! At Franklin you also have the opportunity to enjoy the permaculture garden where we grow the ingredients and herbs used in our food.

name: Hampshire Dining Commons
description: Located in the Southwest Residential Area, Hampshire Dining Commons prides itself on healthy eating, sustainability, world flavors, and community. Hampshire offers a variety of options including a vegetarian line, gluten free options, noodle bowls, hand rolled sushi, authentic street food, grill station, and much more.

name: Berkshire Dining Commons
description: Located in the Southwest Residential Area, this award winning dining common features many display cooking areas with freshness in mind. Come enjoy hand rolled sushi, stir fry station, authentic international cuisine, fresh salad bar, customizable deli bar, pizza, and so much more!
late_night_hours: 9pm-12am Sunday-Thursday, 9pm-12am Friday & Saturday (Late Owl Cafe @ Berkshire Dining Commons)

name: About UMass Amherst Dining
description: Home Cooking, local sourcing, using freshly prepared ingredients, serving sustainable seafood, offering global cuisine and serving food that is good for you; these phrases sound familiar when describing the kind of food you would like to eat at home, but they can also describe the guiding principles of the food we prepare in the kitchens of UMass Dining. Our mission is to serve you a variety of healthy and flavorful meals featuring local, regional and world cuisine, served in a sustainable and e

category.name: UMass Dining
category.description: Welcome! Whether you're new to campus or returning, we are delighted to have you as part of our community. It's always a pleasure to serve you at UMass Dining. To the Class of 2026, we wish you all the best as you navigate your final year. For all students, we hope your time here is filled with success, great experiences, and delicious meals. I also want to express my gratitude to our dedicated dining staff, student employees, and campus partners for their continued commitment to providing outst

category.name: Meal Plan
category.description: All semester meal plans follow the residence halls schedule of operations during the academic year. Semester meal plans begin on the residence halls move-in day for first year students. Semester meal plans conclude at the end of the semester.

category.name: About UMass Amherst Dining

Our mission is to serve you a variety of healthy and flavorful meals featuring local, regional and world cuisine, served in a sustainable and e

category.name: UMass Dining Sustainability Initiatives
category.description: In partnership with My Emissions, UMass Dining is launching an A-E carbon footprint rating system on menu identifiers that will be accompanied by an educational campaign on Dining for a Cooler Planet. Calculations are done in partnership with My Emissions. For more information visit: Low Carbon Dining at UMass

category.name: Nutrition
category.description: Register with Disability Services Navigate Mobile and Web Menus Review UMass Dining’s Allergy/Restriction Information Join our Food Restriction Support Group Book an appointment with Dietitian

category.name: UMass Amherst News & Events
category.description: Stay up to date with all the new and exciting happenings at UMass Dining. Check back often as our blog, photo gallery and news page are ever changing. Go UMass!

category.name: Food Security Initiatives
category.description: 1. Contact the Dean of Students Office and find Single Stop Resources:
category.hours_text: 2. Retail & Cafe Value Meals Value meals at Retail locations with prices starting at $5.00. Reduced food prices at all cafés one hour before close; menu items include sandwiches, salads and baked goods and are 50% off one hour before close. The program allows students to stretch their dining dollars and meal exchanges. Additionally, graduate students can take advantage of the half-priced items one hour before close at the campus cafes— the half price brings many menu items down to $2.50 to $4.00.

category.name: Jobs
category.description: UMass Dining employs 1,200 students per year. We understand your education is a priority, we offer flexible working hours built around your class schedule! Join award-winning UMass Dining today. Click the link to see a full list of dining locations and get started today: https://umassdining.com/student-jobs
category.hours_text: UMass Dining employs 1,200 students per year. We understand your education is a priority, we offer flexible working hours built around your class schedule! category.name: Grab ‘N Go
category.description: Perfect for someone on the go looking for a quick trip to the dining commons! With a menu rotating daily, for 1 Meal swipe students can choose 1 entree and 4 sides. Side options range from hot sides, fruit, veggies, dessert, beverages, and more!

category.name: Campus Center
category.description: Located on the main concourse of the Campus Center, People’s Organic offers natural, organic, and sustainable foods. Choose from a selection of salads, paninis, fresh cookies, locally baked pastries, and so much more. People’s organic serves Fair Trade coffees, features a variety of coffee beverages, and organic teas.

category.name: Around Campus
category.description: Located in the Whitmore Administration Building, Whitmore Cafe is the perfect place to enjoy freshly brewed Coffee, fresh baked pastry, hot paninis, delicious salad, and much more!

category.name: Off-Campus
category.description: The University of Massachusetts Club is a private social club for alumni, faculty, staff and friends of the entire UMass system - Amherst, Boston, Dartmouth, Lowell and the Medical School. You can find us on the top of Boston’s Beacon Hill. We’ve got the best spot in the city to host your business functions, work remotely, grab a bite to eat and network.

category.name: Student Businesses
category.description: Sweets & More, a student-run cooperative business, has been serving UMass Amherst students with quality baked goods, ice cream, and late-night snacks since 1975. Every night at Sweets & More is a fun one - for customers and co-managers alike

category.name: The Commonwealth Restaurant
category.description: We proudly welcome you to The Commonwealth Restaurant. Located on the top floor of Worcester Commons, our elegantly modern restaurant offers a relaxed atmosphere featuring beautiful views of campus. Enjoy a delicious, fresh, local, and sustainable menu along with a full bar service, five days a week. Whether you’re visiting campus, entertaining campus guests, or simply grabbing a bite to eat, dining with us is an experience worth repeating.

category.name: UMass Get Well Meals
category.description: The Award Winning UMass Dining offers a wide variety of world cuisine with a mission to put students first. UMass Dining offers Get Well Meals to students who are unable to dine due to an illness. The Get Well Meals include comfort items and are packaged for pick up.

category.name: Useful Links
category.description: Award Winning UMass Dining is known for its extremely strong culinary program, professional customer service and can-do attitude, but not without the tireless efforts of our management team, students and culinary workers. Meet the team that make UMass Dining shine bright everyday!

category.name: UMass Living Laboratory
category.description: Health and Wellness is an area of increasing importance, leading UMass Dining to partner with the UMass Amherst School of Public Health and Health Sciences and Dr. Lisa Tory to conduct a comprehensive study on the effects of healthy eating and academic performance.

category.name: Privacy Policy
category.description: UMass Dining is committed to preserving and maintaining the privacy of visitors to its Mobile Application and Website. When you download the UMass Dining App, or visit www.UMassDining.com, and all pages within, your visit is anonymous, without tracking of any individual name or other identifiable mark. Like most websites, we collect aggregate user data to understand patterns and improve the website experience. When Information Is Collected We collect information from you when you visit the webli

category.name: Partner With Us
category.description: Let’s collaborate to support and promote excellence in collegiate dining! It’s a great way to offer students a first look at new recipes, products and your brand. Explore the different ways that make the largest collegiate dining program in America a resource for the industry’s next big thing. Our programs include:

category.name: Useful Links
category.description: Located in the Northeast Residential Area, Worcester Dining Commons is the newest and one of the most popular dining facilities on campus. Worcester offers a variety of options including Mediterranean, authentic street food, tandoor Indian kitchen, hand rolled sushi, noodle bowls, pizza, and much more!

category.name: Useful Links
category.description: Housed in two colonial era New England farmhouses; The Boltwood-Stockbridge House built in 1728 is the oldest house in Amherst. Many of the ingredients we use to create our unique menu come from local farms. All of our breads and bakery items are from the University Bake Shop. Our friendly, attentive staff and fresh high-quality dishes are sure to make dining with us and experience you’ll want to return for again and again.

category.name: Useful Links
category.description: Find the babyBerk food truck around campus featuring their famous babyBerk burger, golden BBQ, and UMac and Nash: Nashville hot chicken quesadilla with Mac and cheese!

category.name: FAQ
category.description: Below is a list of frequently asked questions. If you do not find the answer to your question here, please feel free to contact us .
category.hours_text: All dining commons are open continuously from breakfast through dinner, 7 days a week and Worcester and Berkshire offer late night options Sunday through Thursday. Breakfast on the Run and Grab ‘n Go lunch options are available during the week at all dining commons when you don’t have the time to sit and eat. During Exam Periods evening hours are extended.

category.name: For Parents
category.description: Welcome to UMass! I know you want your student to eat well and study smart. UMass Dining is the place to be.

category.name: Additional Resources
category.description: UMass Dining has a No Student Goes Hungry Policy, for more information call our meal plan office at (413) 545-2472 or contact the Dean of Students Main Office at (413) 545-2684. Visit our "Food Security Initiatives" page to learn more.
category.hours_text: Holidays, breaks and campus closures affect UMass Dining hours of Operation. To find out the latest hours visit
